channel.title: Half Life 1 glitches
channel.description:
I have a few problems in Half-Life 1.
I got the disk version (before STEAM.)
First off, when I pause the game, instead of going to the menu screen like it should, my screen turns black until I unpause it. Next, when the houndeyes do their attack, there is no shockwave for it, just the sound. Lastly, none of the music plays, I have the music set to full volume but it wont play.
I hope you guys can help.

item.title: Half Life 1 glitches
item.dc:creator: Xilefian
item.description:
My favourite bug in Half-Life is before there was any kind of Vista patch, I moved my savefile from an XP machine to a Vista machine, loaded it up and it was Blast Pit, with the three clangy-tentacles in the middle. I opened a door and it didn’t work, so I tried opening it again and the thing went the wrong way! Then I walked through the now empty door-way, turned the corner to see the door floating over the blast pit, through all the walls, it wouldn’t stop moving!
That caused me to start playing over again.

My 2nd favourite glitch; I was modding half-life, decided to play the regular game without any of my mods, go to the end of the tram and waited for barney to open the tram door. He just stood there and never came!

item.title: Half Life 1 glitches
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
Yeah, d3d used to be less stable and people chose software mode for stability, but you never know, the code for goldsource had alot of weird glitches involving the main menu, especially in CS.

Also you’ll find that d3d and openGL look and behave exactly the same way, because they’re just different wrappers, one is closed source and the other is open source. If openGL doesn’t work you’ll need to download the proper drivers for your graphics card.

item.title: Half Life 1 glitches
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
I think your monitor may have some problems with high refresh rate, modern graphic cards don’t handle low resolutions very well.

The WON hl menu is in 640x480 and your video card could be trying to feed it in 100hz or more, because of some random bug in the video drivers.

I don’t know about the music, but my suggestion is to download the latest patch for WON hl or download a no-cd patch.
